intro: Klugia azurea var. costaricensis, commonly known as the Costa Rican bluebottle, is a striking member of the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its vibrant blue and purple flowers, which are typically arranged in showy terminal clusters. The plant features palmate leaves with a waxy surface, and its stems are often covered in fine, soft hairs. Native to Central America, it thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in horticulture, though it requires specific care to flourish.
